verses.kjv: O foolish Galatians, who hath bewitched you, that ye should not obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ hath been evidently set forth, crucified among you?
verses.web: Foolish Galatians, who has bewitched you not to obey the truth, before whose eyes Jesus Christ was openly portrayed among you as crucified?
verses.ct: You foolish Galatians! Who has cast a spell on you? Jesus Christ was clearly portrayed as crucified right before your eyes!

verses.kjv: This only would I learn of you, Received ye the Spirit by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
verses.web: I just want to learn this from you: Did you receive the Spirit by the works of the law, or by hearing of faith?
verses.ct: I only want to know one thing from you: Did you receive the Holy Spirit by obeying the law, or by hearing the message and believing it?

verses.kjv: Are ye so foolish? having begun in the Spirit, are ye now made perfect by the flesh?
verses.web: Are you so foolish? Having begun in the Spirit, are you now completed in the flesh?
verses.ct: How can you be so foolish? You started your journey with the Holy Spirit — are you now trying to finish it by your own human effort?

verses.kjv: Have ye suffered so many things in vain? if it be yet in vain.
verses.web: Did you suffer so many things in vain, if it is indeed in vain?
verses.ct: Did you go through all that suffering for nothing? I hope it wasn't for nothing.

verses.kjv: He therefore that ministereth to you the Spirit, and worketh miracles among you, doeth he it by the works of the law, or by the hearing of faith?
verses.web: He therefore who supplies the Spirit to you and does miracles among you, does he do it by the works of the law, or by hearing of faith?
verses.ct: When God gives you his Holy Spirit and works miracles among you, does he do it because you obey the law, or because you heard the message and believed?

verses.kjv: Even as Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him for righteousness.
verses.web: Even as Abraham “believed God, and it was counted to him for righteousness.”
verses.ct: Think about Abraham — he believed God, and God counted that faith as righteousness.

verses.kjv: Know ye therefore that they which are of faith, the same are the children of Abraham.
verses.web: Know therefore that those who are of faith are children of Abraham.
verses.ct: So understand this: the people who live by faith are the true children of Abraham.

verses.kjv: And the scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the heathen through faith, preached before the gospel unto Abraham, saying, In thee shall all nations be blessed.
verses.web: The Scripture, foreseeing that God would justify the Gentiles by faith, preached the Good News beforehand to Abraham, saying, “In you all the nations will be blessed.”
verses.ct: Scripture saw ahead of time that God would make the Gentiles right with himself through faith. That's why it announced the good news to Abraham in advance: "Through you, all nations will be blessed."

verses.kjv: So then they which be of faith are blessed with faithful Abraham.
verses.web: So then, those who are of faith are blessed with the faithful Abraham.
verses.ct: So everyone who lives by faith shares in the same blessing that faithful Abraham received.

verses.kjv: For as many as are of the works of the law are under the curse: for it is written, Cursed is every one that continueth not in all things which are written in the book of the law to do them.
verses.web: For as many as are of the works of the law are under a curse. For it is written, “Cursed is everyone who doesn’t continue in all things that are written in the book of the law, to do them.”
verses.ct: But everyone who relies on obeying the law lives under a curse. Scripture says, "Cursed is everyone who does not continue doing everything written in the book of the law."

verses.kjv: But that no man is justified by the law in the sight of God, it is evident: for, The just shall live by faith.
verses.web: Now that no man is justified by the law before God is evident, for, “The righteous will live by faith.”
verses.ct: It's clear that no one is made right with God by the law, because Scripture says, "The righteous will live by faith."

verses.kjv: And the law is not of faith: but, The man that doeth them shall live in them.
verses.web: The law is not of faith, but, “The man who does them will live by them.”
verses.ct: The law isn't based on faith. Instead, it operates on a different principle: "The person who does these things will live by them."

verses.kjv: Christ hath redeemed us from the curse of the law, being made a curse for us: for it is written, Cursed is every one that hangeth on a tree:
verses.web: Christ redeemed us from the curse of the law, having become a curse for us. For it is written, “Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree,”
verses.ct: Christ rescued us from the curse of the law by becoming a curse in our place. Scripture says, "Cursed is everyone who hangs on a tree."

verses.kjv: That the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Jesus Christ; that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
verses.web: that the blessing of Abraham might come on the Gentiles through Christ Jesus, that we might receive the promise of the Spirit through faith.
verses.ct: He did this so that the blessing given to Abraham would come to the Gentiles through Christ Jesus, and so that we could receive the promised Holy Spirit through faith.

verses.kjv: Brethren, I speak after the manner of men; Though it be but a man’s covenant, yet if it be confirmed, no man disannulleth, or addeth thereto.
verses.web: Brothers, speaking of human terms, though it is only a man’s covenant, yet when it has been confirmed, no one makes it void or adds to it.
verses.ct: Brothers and sisters, let me use an everyday example. Even with a human contract, once it's been signed and sealed, no one can cancel it or add conditions to it.

verses.kjv: Now to Abraham and his seed were the promises made. He saith not, And to seeds, as of many; but as of one, And to thy seed, which is Christ.
verses.web: Now the promises were spoken to Abraham and to his offspring. He doesn’t say, “To descendants”, as of many, but as of one, “To your offspring”, which is Christ.
verses.ct: Now, God made his promises to Abraham and to his offspring. Notice that Scripture doesn't say "and to your offspring" as if referring to many people. It says "and to your offspring" — meaning one person, and that person is Christ.

verses.kjv: And this I say, that the covenant, that was confirmed before of God in Christ, the law, which was four hundred and thirty years after, cannot disannul, that it should make the promise of none effect.
verses.web: Now I say this: A covenant confirmed beforehand by God in Christ, the law, which came four hundred thirty years after, does not annul, so as to make the promise of no effect.
verses.ct: Here's my point: God confirmed a covenant with Abraham. The law, which came 430 years later, can't override that covenant or cancel the promise.

verses.kjv: For if the inheritance be of the law, it is no more of promise: but God gave it to Abraham by promise.
verses.web: For if the inheritance is of the law, it is no more of promise; but God has granted it to Abraham by promise.
verses.ct: If the inheritance depends on the law, then it's no longer based on a promise. But God gave it to Abraham as a free promise.

verses.kjv: Wherefore then serveth the law? It was added because of transgressions, till the seed should come to whom the promise was made; and it was ordained by angels in the hand of a mediator.
verses.web: Then why is there the law? It was added because of transgressions, until the offspring should come to whom the promise has been made. It was ordained through angels by the hand of a mediator.
verses.ct: So what was the purpose of the law? It was added to expose sin and remained in effect until the promised offspring — Christ — arrived. The law was delivered through angels and given through a mediator.

verses.kjv: Now a mediator is not a mediator of one, but God is one.
verses.web: Now a mediator is not between one, but God is one.
verses.ct: Now, a mediator implies more than one party, but God is one.

verses.kjv: Is the law then against the promises of God? God forbid: for if there had been a law given which could have given life, verily righteousness should have been by the law.
verses.web: Is the law then against the promises of God? Certainly not! For if there had been a law given which could make alive, most certainly righteousness would have been of the law.
verses.ct: Does that mean the law works against God's promises? Absolutely not! If a law had been given that could actually give life, then righteousness really would have come through the law.

verses.kjv: But the scripture hath concluded all under sin, that the promise by faith of Jesus Christ might be given to them that believe.
verses.web: But the Scripture imprisoned all things under sin, that the promise by faith in Jesus Christ might be given to those who believe.
verses.ct: But Scripture declares that everything is trapped under the power of sin, so that the promise — given through faith in Jesus Christ — would be offered to everyone who believes.

verses.kjv: But before faith came, we were kept under the law, shut up unto the faith which should afterwards be revealed.
verses.web: But before faith came, we were kept in custody under the law, confined for the faith which should afterwards be revealed.
verses.ct: Before faith in Christ came, we were held prisoner by the law, locked up until this coming faith would be revealed.

verses.kjv: Wherefore the law was our schoolmaster to bring us unto Christ, that we might be justified by faith.
verses.web: So that the law has become our tutor to bring us to Christ, that we might be justified by faith.
verses.ct: So the law served as our guardian to lead us to Christ, so that we could be made right with God through faith.

verses.kjv: But after that faith is come, we are no longer under a schoolmaster.
verses.web: But now that faith has come, we are no longer under a tutor.
verses.ct: But now that faith has come, we're no longer under that guardian.

verses.kjv: For ye are all the children of God by faith in Christ Jesus.
verses.web: For you are all children of God, through faith in Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: You are all children of God through faith in Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: For as many of you as have been baptized into Christ have put on Christ.
verses.web: For as many of you as were baptized into Christ have put on Christ.
verses.ct: Every one of you who was baptized into Christ has been clothed with Christ.

verses.kjv: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither bond nor free, there is neither male nor female: for ye are all one in Christ Jesus.
verses.web: There is neither Jew nor Greek, there is neither slave nor free man, there is neither male nor female; for you are all one in Christ Jesus.
verses.ct: There is no longer Jew or Greek, slave or free, male or female — you are all one in Christ Jesus.

verses.kjv: And if ye be Christ’s, then are ye Abraham’s seed, and heirs according to the promise.
verses.web: If you are Christ’s, then you are Abraham’s offspring and heirs according to promise.
verses.ct: And if you belong to Christ, then you are Abraham's offspring and heirs of everything God promised.
